page.title: 01TREGONY GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: (Our survey covered only 2/3 of the actual village) The 104 pre 1950 properties of Tregony are mainly sited along the wide Fore Street and Tregony Hill.Terraced,stone built,they are unified by scale and architectural simplicity. The main thoroughfare descends a spur ending abruptly at the R.Fal where a bridging point is a focus of five roads.The village core's appearance has changed little since the 1870s but a major convenience was main water and sewage,established in 1963. The pull of Truro's catchment area has decreased village facilities.Within the past 25 years 4 shops and a garage have closed but Spar,Central Stores, Post Office and 1 front room shop (Wheelers) continue.Since 1975 a butchers has been reestablished and significantly a furrier,(see page 2)
